result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel N. Meindl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Daniel N. Meindl in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed in Court.  Attorney Bricco waives formal reading.  Defendant pleads guilty to the amended counts #1 and 2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2.  Count # 3 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following: Ct. #1.  
30 days jail consecutive to count #2. (Credit -30 days).  TIME SERVED.
COSTS:  $243.00 bail to be applied.  

The Court Orders the Following: Ct. #2.  
30 days jail consecutive to count #1. (Credit -30 days).  TIME SERVED.
COSTS:  $243.00 bail to be applied.  

Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.

Defendant Daniel N. Meindl in court, in custody. Attorney Andrea M. Will appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is a new DTC participant - State has no objection to stay of the balance of the condition time on 14CF699. 
Court stays the balance of the condition time on 14CF699 EFFECTIVE October 22, 2014 - is to be released BY 8:00 am on October 22, 2014 DIRECTLY to WCS Staff. Bail has been paid/posted on 14CF199 already.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Daniel N. Meindl in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the penalty enhancer from Count 1.  Court grants motion.  Penalty enhancer struck from Count 1.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment and approves the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read in.  Court orders $4,500.00 of the cash bail to be refunded to the poster.  The remaining $500.00 to be held pending defendant's completion of DTC.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on October 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
